archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
did.abstract: The Virginia Tech Rescue Squad Papers is a collection of the minutes of the Rescue Squad's executive board. The minutes span the years 1970-1994.
did.origination: The Virginia Tech Rescue Squad Papers were donated to the Special Collections in 1996.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Virginia Tech Rescue Squad Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Tech Rescue Squad Papers, Ms96-022, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The mission of the Virginia Tech Rescue Squad, which was founded in 1969, is to provide emergency medical care to the campus community of Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. All personnel are volunteers. The majority of the personnel are undergraduate students. Some faculty, graduate students, and Blacksburg citizens participate in the squad as Associate Members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Virginia Tech Rescue Squad Papers is a collection of the minutes of the Rescue Squad's executive board. The minutes span the years 1970-1994. Years included are 1970-72, 1980, 1985-88, 1991-92, and 1993- 94.
